Temples.Name: Aba Nigeria Temple
Temples.Location: 72-80 Okpu-Umuobo Rd Aba Abia State, Nigeria
Temples.Services: Patron Housing available, Distribution center nearby
Temples.History: The temple was announced 2 April 2000, Church leaders broke ground 23 February 2002, and Gordon B. Hinckley, president of The Church of Jesus Christ of Latter-day Saints from 1995 to 2008, dedicated the Aba Nigeria Temple 7 August 2005. The temple serves Latter-day Saints in Nigeria and Cameroon.

Temples.Name: Accra Ghana Temple
Temples.Location: Accra Ghana Temple Complex 57 Independence Ave, North Ridge P.M.B. CT 209, Cantonments, Accra, Ghana
Temples.Services: Patron Housing available, Distribution center nearby
Temples.History: The temple in Accra is the second of three temples built in Africa. The first Mormon missionaries came to Ghana in 1978. Many of the people present at the announcement of the temple had been some of the first converts in Ghana. A site dedication and groundbreaking ceremony was held on November 16, 2001.

Temples.Name: London England Temple
Temples.Location: West Park Road Newchapel Surrey, England RH7 6HW, United Kingdom
Temples.Services: Clothing rental available, No cafeteria available, Patron housing available, Distribution center nearby
Temples.History: In an area where the Church has long been established—the first unit was created in Preston in 1837, just seven years after the Church was officially organized—the London Temple stands as the first temple in the United Kingdom and is the Church's 12th operating temple

Temples.Name: Manhattan New York Temple
Temples.Location: 125 Columbus Ave, Fourth Floor New York NY 10023-6514 United States
Temples.Services: Clothing rental available, No cafeteria available, No patron housing available, Distribution center nearby
Temples.History: The Manhattan New York Temple is the 119th operating temple of The Church of Jesus Christ of Latter-day Saints (LDS Church). It is the second high rise LDS temple to be constructed, after the Hong Kong China Temple, and the third LDS temple converted from an existing building.

Temples.Name: Bountiful Utah Temple
Temples.Location: 640 S Bountiful Blvd Bountiful UT 84010-1394 United States
Temples.Services: Clothing rental available No cafeteria available No patron housing available Distribution center nearby
Temples.History: After considering numerous sites for the temple, the final decision was made on April 3, 1988, by church's First Presidency. Four years later, on May 2, 1992, the groundbreaking took place and on January 8, 1995, church president Howard W. Hunter dedicated the Bountiful Utah Temple.

Temples.Name: Chicago Illinois Temple
Temples.Location: 4151 W Lake Ave Glenview IL 60025-1240 United States
Temples.Services: Clothing rental available No cafeteria available No patron housing available Distribution center nearby
Temples.History: Located in the Chicago suburb of Glenview, the site of Chicago Illinois Temple was dedicated on August 13, 1983 by Gordon B. Hinckley, a member of the church's First Presidency. The structure itself was constructed in gray buff marble and its roof features gray slate.

Temples.Name: Dallas Texas Temple
Temples.Location: 6363 Willow Ln Dallas TX 75230-2227 United States
Temples.Services: Clothing rental available, No cafeteria available, No patron housing available, Distribution center nearby
Temples.History: Located in Dallas, Texas, the temple was dedicated on October 19, 1984 by Gordon B. Hinckley.[1] The temple sits on a 6-acre (24,000 m2) site and was originally 18,000 square feet (1,700 m2). It was the first temple in Texas and the South Central United States.

Temples.History: The Idaho Falls Idaho Temple is the tenth constructed and eighth operating temple of The Church of Jesus Christ of Latter-day Saints. Located in the city of Idaho Falls, Idaho, it was the church's first temple built in Idaho, and the first built with a modern single-spire design

Temples.Name: Las Vegas Nevada Temple
Temples.Location: 827 Temple View Dr Las Vegas NV 89110-2920 United States
Temples.Services: Clothing rental available, No cafeteria available, No patron housing available, Distribution center nearby
Temples.History: Located in the Sunrise Manor CDP near Las Vegas, Nevada, the temple sits on 10.3 acres (4.2 ha) of land at the base of Frenchman Mountain. A groundbreaking ceremony and site dedication for the temple were held in November 1985. Gordon B. Hinckley, presided and gave the dedication prayer.

Temples.History: On 22 October 2015 the church announced that the temple would be constructed in the Parque das Nações area of Lisbon, along Avenida Dom João II. A groundbreaking ceremony, to signify the beginning of construction, took place on 5 December 2015, with Patrick Kearon presiding.

Temples.Name: Orlando Florida Temple
Temples.Location: 9000 Windy Ridge Rd Windermere FL 34786-8347 United States
Temples.Services: Clothing rental available, No cafeteria available, No patron housing available, Distribution center nearby
Temples.History: The Orlando Florida Temple is the 48th constructed and 46th operating temple of The Church of Jesus Christ of Latter-day Saints. Located near Windermere, Florida, it was built with a modern single-spire design. It is the second largest LDS temple in the Eastern United States, after the Washington D.C. Temple.

Temples.Name: Rome Italy Temple
Temples.Location: Via di Settebagni 376 Rome RM Italy
Temples.Services: Clothing rental available, No cafeteria available, No patron housing available, Distribution center nearby
Temples.History: The groundbreaking ceremony for the temple was held 23 October 2010, with Monson presiding.[8] Only invited guests were allowed to be at the groundbreaking, but the ceremony was rebroadcast to Latter-day Saint meetinghouses in Italy the following day, to provide greater participation.
